alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:33PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Franklin and southwestern Bear Lake Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 528 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a couple of thunderstorms near Saint Charles, or near Bear Lake Idaho Portion, that are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain with nearly stationary storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall with nearly stationary storms could create localized flooding. Do not go through flooded roadways or trails. Locations impacted include... Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Saint Charles, Bloomington, Fish Haven and Minnetonka Cave. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall that is mostly stationary is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
